benchmark_details.name: Forbidden Science: Dual-Use AI Challenge Benchmark and Scientific Refusal Tests
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents an open-source dataset and testing framework for evaluating large language model (LLM) safety mechanisms across controlled substance queries, analyzing four major models' responses to systematically varied prompts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that allows for systematic evaluation of the balance between safety restrictions and potential over-censorship in scientific inquiry by LLMs.

data.source: Publicly available datasets from US government agencies (OSHA, FDA, EPA) and novel curated prompts.
data.annotation: Manually curated by researchers with a focus on dual-use scientific queries.

methodology.calculation: Measured response refusal rates and analyzed the variability in responses across different prompt engineering strategies.
methodology.interpretation: The analysis aims to detect the effectiveness of model responses in handling sensitive scientific queries without unnecessary censorship.
methodology.validation: Results were validated by comparing responses across major LLMs against established literature.
